Cloning immediately after expanding also "resolves" the issue:

def rsample(self, sample_shape=()):
    shape = self._extended_shape(sample_shape)
    # this clone has no effect
    # self.concentration = self.concentration.clone()
    print(self.concentration)
    print(shape)
    concentration = self.concentration.expand(shape)
    # this clone "resolves" the issue
    concentration = concentration.clone()

    if isinstance(concentration, torch.Tensor):
        return _Dirichlet.apply(concentration)
    return _dirichlet_sample_nograd(concentration)

body:
After looking a bit more and from my limited understanding of the framework it seems quite likely that `torch._standard_gamma()` is not behaving properly when views are involved. This would affect the Gamma distribution as well

Cloning immediately after expanding also "resolves" the issue:

```
def rsample(self, sample_shape=()):
    shape = self._extended_shape(sample_shape)
    # this clone has no effect
    # self.concentration = self.concentration.clone()
    print(self.concentration)
    print(shape)
    concentration = self.concentration.expand(shape)
    # this clone "resolves" the issue
    concentration = concentration.clone()

    if isinstance(concentration, torch.Tensor):
        return _Dirichlet.apply(concentration)
    return _dirichlet_sample_nograd(concentration)
```
